moves.1. d4: So, heres an exciting game which i played against campeon. White wins blacks queen at the beginning , and soon after sacs a piece for a fierce attack on black. This is how it went down. I start with my usual d4.
moves.1... h6: h6?? Not really a stereotypical opening move
moves.2. e4: I decided to jump on the fact that black is not trying to control the center.
moves.2... d5 3. exd5: This move allows white to gain a tempo and gain major control over the center
moves.3... Qxd5 4. c4: Attacks blacks queen and jumps on center
moves.4... Qe4+: I was expecting queen to retreat all the way to d8
moves.5. Be3 e6 6. a3: With this move i wanted to secure my tempo gain with the knight, by avoiding the pin
moves.6... Nf6 7. Nc3 Qc6 8. c5: This move comes with a thread my opponet failed to reckon
moves.8... Nd5 9. Bb5: The queen is pinned to the king
moves.9... Nxc3: This doesnt work because bxc6 comes with check
moves.10. Bxc6+ bxc6 11. bxc3 Nd7 12. Nf3: This was an odd position becuse both player have doubled pawns on the c file
moves.12... Be7 13. O-O Ba6: Just helps white to develop his rook
moves.17... Nd5 18. Bxh6 gxh6 19. Qxh6: Blacks king side is torn apart and white is readh bring reinforcements in to the attack
moves.19... Bf6 20. Re4: Threatening rg4+ with mate to follow
moves.20... Bd3: Allows bg6 to block the check
moves.23. Qg5: I thought about saccing the exchange instantly but decided to virtually pinn blacks lsb
moves.24. Rb7: Only move really because after nxg4 blacks lsb is unpinned and free to grab the rook
moves.24... Nxg4 25. Qxg4 Kh8: Defends against h5 winnimg a piece
moves.26. Rxc7 Rfg8 27. Rxc6: White grabs 2 pawns and is still clearly winning
moves.27... Rab8 28. Ra6 Rb1+ 29. Kh2 Rb3: Maybe blacks shouldnt be going for whites pawns here
moves.30. Rxa7 Rxc3 31. a4 Rc4: Pins the d pawn but other than thag does nothing
moves.35. Ng5: Ng5!! Threatens instant mate and forces a mate in a couple of moves
moves.36. Nxf7+ Kg8: Rxf7 wont help because after rxf7 its a mate in two
